snippet: Restorative justice, which encourages young people to develop empathy for one another, is increasingly offered in schools seeking an alternative to “zero tolerance” policies.
abstract: Restorative justice, which encourages young students with a history of getting into trouble to develop empathy for one another, is increasingly offered in schools seeking an alternative to 'zero tolerance' policies; approach taking root in Oakland, Calif, and other cities tries to stop problems and violence by forging closer, franker relationships among students, teachers and administrators.
lead_paragraph: Restorative justice, which encourages young people to develop empathy for one another, is increasingly offered in schools seeking an alternative to “zero tolerance” policies.

headline.seo: Restorative Justice Programs Take Root in Schools
headline.main: Opening Up, Students Transform a Vicious Circle
headline.print_headline: Students Find Opening Up Transforms Vicious Circle
